GameModifier.Provides: If they can survive without the metal mail, this vest will quickly make a weakling into a soldier.

GameItemType.Description: This vest will put you in touch with nature. But keep in mind that you'll smell like a swamp for weeks.

GameItemType.Description: Numerous studies ordered by Amarian III have indicated warming-up before battle as a way to increase performance, reduce injuries, and reduce deaths (Post-battle executions excluded from the study). It's getting the other party to agree to a warm up session that's been creating problems, especially when ambushed.

GameItemType.Description: Confidence does wonder. For men.
A good defense is the best offence. This armor magically inclines the wearer to better understand the armor of others - and the weaknesses therein.

GameModifier.Provides: A good defense is the best offence. This armor magically inclines the wearer to better understand the armor of others - and the weaknesses therein.

GameItemType.Description: There is a monument somewhere to King Horus, who exclaimed that he would never die. While he wore this helmet, there may have been truth to his claims.

::: Helm of Horus ::: ::: If killed, resurrected w/ 50% HP. Once.

GameItemType.Description: Keep your friends at a distance when wearing this helm. For the ties of fellowship are nothing against the clever ambitions that inspire the wearer, and no bond of trust is safe before them.

GameModifier.Provides: Keep your friends at a distance when wearing this helm. For the ties of fellowship are nothing against the clever ambitions that inspire the wearer, and no bond of trust is safe before them.

GameItemType.Description: A thousand wailers attended Sultan Am-sul entombment, but unsatisfied with their lamentations, the new Sultan had them all slain, transferring their mournful cries to a magically embroidered fez. While he then used that fez to torture people, the wails are so concentrated that they prevent similar sounds from affecting anyone within range, acting as an anti-acoustic device.

GameItemType.Description: A holdover from the arenas of Capitar, before Tarth led the revolt. What was once a mark of enslavement is now worn proudly by Tarth champions.

GameModifier.Provides: A holdover from the arenas of Capitar, before Tarth led the revolt. What was once a mark of enslavement is now worn proudly by Tarth champions.

GameItemType.Description: After studying numerous monk's robes, monastic scholars managed to discover the necessary materials and enchantments to make them. By adding a metal mesh sewn into the fabric, they created a robe that, while being slightly heavier, could better defend young missionaries.

GameItemType.Description: This magical device let's you throw rocks with the force of a catapult. Where the rocks are from, you don't know, but you imagine an ogre foreman wakes up in the morning to find his quarry empty and that puts a smile on your face. GameItemType.Description:
Some items are crafted by magic into beautiful works. Creations such as this are so sublimely perfect and effective it almost seems an insult to wear them.
Far tougher than any non-magic metal, Elementium was found in the age before the Titans, deep beneath the surface of the world. Items made from Elementium are inherently magical, unlike most other magical items that have either been enchanted, cursed, or are from another world. Inherently magical materials are exceedingly rare, and practically immune to the tyranny of time - they will not rust or break down over time. Items crafted from such materials will draw power from the surrounding world in order to repair itself, or even strengthen itself over time.

GameModifier.Provides: Some items are crafted by magic into beautiful works. Creations such as this are so sublimely perfect and effective it almost seems an insult to wear them.
::: Armor Pierce ::: ::: Ignores 40% of the target's DEF

GameItemType.Description: Magnar ordered his archers to fire and the arrows rained down as thick as grass in a field. Through each volley Queen Procipinee continued forward, blue light radiating from her hands and controlled power in her eyes. Though an army stood against her, no arrow struck her.

GameItemType.Description: This is sometimes considered the 11th book of the Decalon. It is a single, lengthy narrative regarding the exploits of a thief named T'Sha Villere. Villere spent most of his time searching the catacombs beneath the Verhaellem for treasure.

GameItemType.Description: A biography of the great men and women of the past, and some of their more inspirational deeds - tales of Ereog and the army of men he put together to confront Az-Adoras, the Dark Prince of Al-Ashteroth. GameItemType.Description: The complex interlaying of chain links on this coif are clearly the efforts of a master armorsmith and have resulted in a more resilient helmet.

GameModifier.Provides: The complex interlaying of chain links on this coif are clearly the efforts of a master armorsmith and have resulted in a more resilient helmet.

GameItemType.Description: The aura of protective energy emanating from this otherwise ordinary chain coif seems to be the work of a skilled enchanter.

GameModifier.Provides: The aura of protective energy emanating from this otherwise ordinary chain coif seems to be the work of a skilled enchanter.

GameItemType.Description: These armlets are constructed from interlaced metal rings.

GameModifier.Provides: These armlets are constructed from interlaced metal rings.

GameItemType.Description: The chain links of this pair of armlets have been woven together in a pattern that reinforces their strength. It is clearly the work of a master armorsmith.

GameModifier.Provides: The chain links of this pair of armlets have been woven together in a pattern that reinforces their strength. It is clearly the work of a master armorsmith.

GameItemType.Description: These scale gauntlets heighten the spellcasting power of the wearer.

GameModifier.Provides: These scale gauntlets heighten the spellcasting power of the wearer.

GameItemType.Description: You would still be burnt to ash if a dragon breathed on you while wearing this cloak, but not as much.

GameModifier.Provides: You would still be burnt to ash if a dragon breathed on you while wearing this cloak, but not as much.

GameItemType.Description: It's hard to communicate above a series of grunts while wearing it. As for your capacity for ferocious murder however, you shall become deeply fluent.

GameModifier.Provides: It's hard to communicate above a series of grunts while wearing it. As for your capacity for ferocious murder however, you shall become deeply fluent.

GameItemType.Description: This cloak is made of magically-enhanced herbage; make sure your verdure is free of berries, as they are known to attract Cave Bears.

GameModifier.Provides: This cloak is made of magically-enhanced herbage; make sure your verdure is free of berries, as they are known to attract Cave Bears.

GameItemType.Description: The only known recipe for these cloaks, said to be a hoax, called for a powerful channeler to self-immolate. This cloak would be the useful product.

GameModifier.Provides: The only known recipe for these cloaks, said to be a hoax, called for a powerful channeler to self-immolate. This cloak would be the useful product.

GameItemType.Description: According to your planetary ecologist, whose crushed remains were found (along with his report) under a Sandworm scale, Sandworms shed one scale per month on average.

GameModifier.Provides: According to your planetary ecologist, whose crushed remains were found (along with his report) under a Sandworm scale, Sandworms shed one scale per month on average.

GameItemType.Description: It's not easy being green. But is it sexy.

GameModifier.Provides: It's not easy being green. But is it sexy.
::: Can Cast Airwalk IF Faith Air
::: Can Cast Waterwalk ::: See WARNINGS before casting

GameItemType.Description: Some Gilden Lions have absorbed so much Fire Shard radiations that even when they die, the magic persists on their hide.

GameModifier.Provides: Some Gilden Lions have absorbed so much Fire Shard radiations that even when they die, the magic persists on their hide.

GameItemType.Description: That these cloaks can be made from shrill carapace, and sold for fair profit, makes the snap of a dead shrill potentially even more satisfying.

GameModifier.Provides: That these cloaks can be made from shrill carapace, and sold for fair profit, makes the snap of a dead shrill potentially even more satisfying.

GameItemType.Description: These cloaks are the product of a channeler's failed attempt to woo a woman by completing her impossible request: wear lightning as if it were slain wolf's hide.

GameModifier.Provides: These cloaks are the product of a channeler's failed attempt to woo a woman by completing her impossible request: wear lightning as if it were slain wolf's hide.

GameItemType.Description: If an Air Elemental witnesses one of these cloaks being worn, it will hunt the owner across the world, never ceasing. Only death of the Elemental or its retrieval of the cloak will end its rage.

GameModifier.Provides: If an Air Elemental witnesses one of these cloaks being worn, it will hunt the owner across the world, never ceasing. Only death of the Elemental or its retrieval of the cloak will end its rage.

GameItemType.Description: Weigh the protection of this item against the visions of the future that invariably come. You may not appreciate knowing some fates in advance, for the visions are quite accurate.

GameModifier.Provides: Weigh the protection of this item against the visions of the future that invariably come. You may not appreciate knowing some fates in advance, for the visions are quite accurate.

GameItemType.Description: The former owner of this mantle brewed beer that was bought by the barrel for an entire fortune. For that brew was said to make those who drank of it renewed, and forever wiped of trouble memory.

GameModifier.Provides: The former owner of this mantle brewed beer that was bought by the barrel for an entire fortune. For that brew was said to make those who drank of it renewed, and forever wiped of trouble memory.

GameItemType.Description: Do not wear it while you sleep. Ignore this warning, and you may awaken as an ophidian yourself, forever transfixed.

GameModifier.Provides: Do not wear it while you sleep. Ignore this warning, and you may awaken as an ophidian yourself, forever transfixed.

GameItemType.Description: Quendar slaves are usually sent to gather the hides for making these cloaks. Those who handle the plagued skin rarely are long for this world.

GameModifier.Provides: Quendar slaves are usually sent to gather the hides for making these cloaks. Those who handle the plagued skin rarely are long for this world.

GameItemType.Description: Most of these cloaks were fashioned because of a Bard's skill with charming Naja. By playing just the correct notes, the Naja were hypnotized long enough to be struck in the head and killed.

GameModifier.Provides: Most of these cloaks were fashioned because of a Bard's skill with charming Naja. By playing just the correct notes, the Naja were hypnotized long enough to be struck in the head and killed.

GameItemType.Description: This is sculpted out of a non inert Earth Elemental, which is the only known way to pass the magic of said elemental into the cloak. The Earth Elemental is not harmed in the process, its exoskeleton will regrow, and it can be harvested again a few weeks later. However, the link with said elemental is never severed and the creature will forever try to find and merge with its missing shell, usually at the expense of its wearer's life. The People for the Ethical Treatment of Automatons (PETA) have called for an end to this barbaric activity.

GameModifier.Provides: This is sculpted out of a non inert Earth Elemental, which is the only known way to pass the magic of said elemental into the cloak. The Earth Elemental is not harmed in the process, its exoskeleton will regrow, and it can be harvested again a few weeks later. However, the link with said elemental is never severed and the creature will forever try to find and merge with its missing shell, usually at the expense of its wearer's life. The People for the Ethical Treatment of Automatons (PETA) have called for an end to this barbaric activity.

GameItemType.Description: Rumor has it the first one of these was crafted not by slaying such a dragon, but by a channeler who won a daring bet against the beast. Ever honorable, it indeed gave up its tongue, but killed anyone that wore the cloak made of its flesh.

GameModifier.Provides: Rumor has it the first one of these was crafted not by slaying such a dragon, but by a channeler who won a daring bet against the beast. Ever honorable, it indeed gave up its tongue, but killed anyone that wore the cloak made of its flesh.

GameItemType.Description: Only the most disciplined soldiers gain the right to wear this. Simply donning one means instant approval of a mortgage loan at the Treasury Vault.

GameModifier.Provides: Only the most disciplined soldiers gain the right to wear this. Simply donning one means instant approval of a mortgage loan at the Treasury Vault.

GameItemType.Description: This cape imbue the wearer with the power of the stars. Its defensive properties rival even enchanted metal armor.

GameModifier.Provides: This cape imbue the wearer with the power of the stars. Its defensive properties rival even enchanted metal armor.

GameItemType.Description: Wear one of these, and other soldiers will pretend to find your story about the milk maid and the farmer hilarious. No it's a good story. Really. I'm not just being nice.

GameModifier.Provides: Wear one of these, and other soldiers will pretend to find your story about the milk maid and the farmer hilarious. No it's a good story. Really. I'm not just being nice.

GameItemType.Description: The cloak of only the finest Ranger's in Elemental.

GameModifier.Provides: The cloak of only the finest Ranger's in Elemental.

GameItemType.Description: The wearer's body seems to disappear into this midnight black cloak.

GameModifier.Provides: The wearer's body seems to disappear into this midnight black cloak.

GameItemType.Description: This dark blue cloak has silver stars twinkling within its depths.

GameModifier.Provides: This dark blue cloak has silver stars twinkling within its depths.

GameItemType.Description: Lights dim when this cloak comes near. Candles flicker and go out, torches flutter and fade.

GameModifier.Provides: Lights dim when this cloak comes near. Candles flicker and go out, torches flutter and fade.

GameItemType.Description: It always points north, leading many to wonder what lies in that direction.

GameModifier.Provides: It always points north, leading many to wonder what lies in that direction.

GameItemType.Description: A blueish tint emanates from this Ancient Tablet. Reading it revitalizes the mind and restores precious mana.

GameModifier.Provides: A blueish tint emanates from this Ancient Tablet. Reading it revitalizes the mind and restores precious mana.

GameItemType.Description: The book describes the required mental operations to start a telepathic link with The Heavenly Shepherd. Besides the fact The Heavenly Shepherd is believed to be a Titan and it's never safe to contact such entity, the spell uses a lot of mana and the fine print suggests he charges by the minute.

GameModifier.Provides: It is said ingesting this whole bear claw will pass the Spirit of the Bear into you. Just keep in mind that the claw will try to kill you as you eat it. Best of luck.

GameItemType.Description: This book has plenty of easy to understand pictures in it.

GameModifier.Provides: This book has plenty of easy to understand pictures in it.

GameItemType.Description: The contents of this book are thought by many to be apocryphal, containing as they do the supposed 'adventures of Breon in the far continent, as told by her daughter Nimmeria.' GameItemType.Description: To a compatible host, this green chalice will always appear full. However, after a night of drinking from it, the chalice inevitably disappears, stolen by green fairies, if one was to believe the host recollection of events. Truth be told, the chalice is a shapeshifting living organism which enters the body while the host is having dreams about green fairies... It's not all bad, this relationship will make you romantic, in a berserk kind of way.

GameModifier.Provides: Outlawed in most Kingdoms and rumored unpalatable; hasn't stopped Blazing Broiler from winning the Fire Giants Summer Solstice Cooking Concours with his mean carbonized Dwarf mechoui.

GameModifier.Provides: Beware: all who have ever read this book are left mute. But they are known to merely gaze at birds, and be perfectly understood.

GameItemType.Description: This book is to be read alone, for only the reader of this knowledge is known to leave a library still breathing.

GameModifier.Provides: This book is to be read alone, for only the reader of this knowledge is known to leave a library still breathing.

GameItemType.Description: Remember the story of Iarnast. A gifted channeler, he delved deep into these pages, and gained all knowledge therein. He then trekked up into the mountains and was never seen hence.

GameModifier.Provides: Remember the story of Iarnast. A gifted channeler, he delved deep into these pages, and gained all knowledge therein. He then trekked up into the mountains and was never seen hence.

GameItemType.Description: Lady Bramanzine read this entire treatise as a condition of her wedding vows. The next day she was named witch, and hunted for the crime of leaving her groom an ashen stain upon their honeymoon linens.

GameModifier.Provides: Lady Bramanzine read this entire treatise as a condition of her wedding vows. The next day she was named witch, and hunted for the crime of leaving her groom an ashen stain upon their honeymoon linens.

GameModifier.Provides: A man visits the library of Alzaina once a year, and reads but a single page. The eldest librarian insists he has been coming since long before she was born, and shall continue to come as long as the library remains.

GameItemType.Description: All who read this book are tested, when they reach the first page and find all the rest blank. Only those who read the first page a thousand times can begin to see the ink of the remaining pages appear, granting vast knowledge.

GameModifier.Provides: Drink this and you'll be resistant to fire. You'll also be resistant to tasting your food ever again.

GameModifier.Provides: Extremly difficult to keep fresh after being drawn, the reward for preserving this blood is powerful: it can keep magic at bay.

GameItemType.Description: You're confused to find a price tag and a short description on the flask: "Memories of ancient battles are therein contained". Apparently, it's sold somewhere in the world.

GameItemType.Description: The key is not make one garden do the work of three. Find a new spot to grow in, instead of sucking every last nutrient out of one good book. I mean, tract of soil.

GameItemType.Description:
------------------------------------------------ !WARNING! Do not "Use" on loot pop-up. ------------------------------------------------
This scroll will bestow 15X experience for any who read it. This is approximately one level if level 1 to 5.

GameModifier.Provides: Several anecdotes of rookies, apprentices, and young interns scrawl upon this scroll. After intensive study, you think you understand what you do a little better. Some sort of magic placed on this scroll destroys it after use.

GameItemType.Description:
------------------------------------------------ !WARNING! Do not "Use" on loot pop-up. ------------------------------------------------
This scroll will bestow 30X experience for any who read it. This is approximately one level if level 6 to 10.

GameModifier.Provides: A quick read of this scroll reveals stories of soldiers, mages, and aides. When you actually sit down to concentrate on reading the scroll, you feel more capable at whatever you do. And then the scroll is somehow destroyed.

GameItemType.Description:
------------------------------------------------ !WARNING! Do not "Use" on loot pop-up. ------------------------------------------------
This scroll will bestow 45X experience for any who read it. This is approximately one level if level 11 to 15.

GameModifier.Provides: You notice, quickly, that military officers, sorcerers, and governing officials wrote down some notes regarding what they do. After spending only a few minutes reading this scroll, your duties seem to come even more naturally. The scroll is mysteriously consumed.

GameItemType.Description:
------------------------------------------------ !WARNING! Do not "Use" on loot pop-up. ------------------------------------------------
This scroll will bestow 60X experience for any who read it. This is approximately one level if level 16 to 20.

GameModifier.Provides: As you read this, you notice the stories of veterans, wizards, and mayors written down. By the time you finish reading, you feel like your duties are almost as easy as walking. As to the scroll magical destruction, though, it's unexplained.

GameItemType.Description:
------------------------------------------------ !WARNING! Do not "Use" on loot pop-up. ------------------------------------------------
This scroll will bestow 75X experience for any who read it. This is approximately one level if level 21 to 25.

GameModifier.Provides: War heroes, sages, and governors took the time to write down, in detail, what they did. You only need skim the scroll to understand it. You feel like you were trained from birth to do your duties. After reading it, you observe the scroll's destruction.

GameItemType.Description:
------------------------------------------------ !WARNING! Do not "Use" on loot pop-up. ------------------------------------------------
This scroll will bestow 90X experience for any who read it. This is approximately one level if level 26 to 30.

GameModifier.Provides: This scroll contains legends. It is said these are the journals, diaries, missives, and similar written down by sovereigns from ages long past. You barely need to read this one to feel that knowledge come to you. Yet, how the scroll is destroyed is beyond you.

GameItemType.Description: Beautifully embroidered with gold thread on red satin.

GameModifier.Provides: Beautifully embroidered with gold thread on red satin.

GameItemType.Description: This tiny fragment is said to be a piece of a doomed Mithrilar. They are known as the Gods Who Were Lost. The Destiny are the collective Mithrilar who were destroyed when the Telenanth was shattered -- an event that occurred long before life came to this world. It is said that the Titans collected the remains of these super beings which had come to take on the form of tiny pieces of strange stone. What magical properties they have we are not sure of. They are, however, much sought after and thus very valuable.

GameModifier.Provides: This tiny fragment is said to be a piece of a doomed Mithrilar.

GameModifier.Provides: Though these arrows allow the arms to move in a blur of motion, their enchantment does not apply to the rest of the body.

GameItemType.Description: The young prefer to hold their weapons in their bare hands. After a few battles few want to touch their weapons again.

GameItemType.Description: Dear Mother, Your fear that I would not be able to handle traveling the wilds was misguided. Thus far my journey has been without any setbacks. I look forward to seeing you soon. -Brion

GameModifier.Provides: Using this letter will summon a mercenary to your group.

GameItemType.Description: I must find the altar of the Assassin's Blade and pray that it isn't a myth. My mother's cruelty cannot continue. If I do not make it, at least I will be free of her.

GameModifier.Provides: I must find the altar of the Assassin's Blade and pray that it isn't a myth. My mother's cruelty cannot continue. If I do not make it, at least I will be free of her.

GameItemType.Description: Well, it's better than nothing, but only barely.
